context: I said something hurtful during an argument
letters:
Dear Mom,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to sincerely apologize for my words during our recent argument. I know I said something that hurt you, and I deeply regret allowing my emotions to take control in that moment.

It was never my intention to cause you pain, and I can't express enough how sorry I am for the thoughtlessness of my remarks. Our relationship means the world to me, and I recognize that my actions may have jeopardized that trust and closeness.

I’ve taken some time to reflect on the situation, and I realize how important it is for me to communicate with you more thoughtfully. I value our conversations and the love we share, which is why it pains me to think I could have damaged that with my words.

Please know that I am committed to learning from this experience and striving to be more respectful and understanding in our discussions. I appreciate your patience with me and hope we can find a way to move forward together.

Thank you for taking the time to read this. I love you and look forward to making things right.

With all my love,

[Your Name]

Hey Mom,

I just wanted to take a moment to say I'm really sorry for what I said during our argument. Looking back, I realize how hurtful my words were, and I truly didn’t mean to upset you. Sometimes my frustrations get the best of me, and I end up saying things I don't really mean.

You mean the world to me, and the last thing I want is to hurt you. I appreciate everything you do, and I promise to be more mindful in the future. Let’s talk when you’re ready—I’d love to clear the air and hopefully make it up to you. 

Love you lots,  
[Your Name]
